programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones struggle when their new shop makes a loss, and hope their find of a comic book at an auction will help to solve the problem.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Bubba, Kenny and Matt compete fiercely over the bargains on offer at an auction in Forth Worth.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: The bidders go to Waxahachie, where Jenny makes a scandalous discovery that could prove very profitable.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit the sites of famous American Civil War battles to unearth valuable and quirky collectibles.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Jamie's new employee tests the boss's patience when he disappears during a blizzard. Plus, the team needs extra help after a fatal crash on the highway.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers examine a holy relic and a letter supposedly signed by Winston Churchill, but are sceptical about both items.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawn shop staff examine a 1960s Cadillac, a collection of baseball world series rings and two antique pistol lighters.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth notices that Ashley is behaving strangely - either low-balling on, or rejecting outright, various items that she would otherwise give higher deals on.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley continues to low-ball and mistreat customers to Seth's detriment, and gets involved in an argument in front of a client over a signed 1970 Detroit Tigers baseball.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto talks to experts in the world of artificial intelligence and investigates Facebook's AI project, which was shut down in 2017.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: While Kenny and Matt bicker over a tool-rich locker in DeSoto, Mary bags a purchase that sparks a trip to the oldest Italian restaurant in Texas.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.sub-title: Welcome to the World of the Sonny Monday
programme.desc: The buyers meet their match in Waxahachie's go-getting locals. Will such stiff competition prevent the team members managing to get their hands on any of the goodies?.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's anger over Seth and Ashley's sibling rivalry boils over to the point that he gives them an ultimatum to calm down or be sacked - but they carry on bickering.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les remains in hospital following his collapse, and Seth and Ashley continue manning operations at the pawn shop. However, the bickering continues.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team receives a handwritten poem by Jimi Hendrix, a 1950s pedal car and a chessboard made for the Titanic.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The pawnbrokers assess a collection of the first three years of Sports Illustrated magazine, a Second World War pilot's jacket and a half-size musket.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have some fun as they attempt to beat the competition, while Casey tries her hand at bidding.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The PA Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: The bidders attend a series of auctions in the southern Californian city of Rancho Cucamonga.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Hollywood seeking stock for their ailing pawn shop business. However, they soon encounter fierce competition for some of the more sought after items.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton visit Hollywood for some stock for their pawn shop business, and the guys decide to take Big Sis to her first auction.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: An auction in Mesquite brings back bad memories for Ricky and Bubba, and Mary makes a strange discovery that leads her to a llama farm.

programme.title: Storage Wars: Texas
programme.desc: Things get hairy in Henderson when an impromptu brawl breaks out among some of the bidders.

programme.title: Mega Disasters
programme.desc: Experts create an imaginary scenario where the Californian coast is hit by a 2km asteroid to examine the impact such a disaster might have on the human population. Potential catastrophes brought on by a collision of such magnitude include firestorms, tsunamis and dust clouds.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Part one of two. Zachary Quinto goes scuba diving, spelunking and mountain climbing through the Mediterranean in search of the site of the fabled city of Atlantis.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth ignores Ashley's wish to ban a troublesome customer - but his decision threatens to put the shop at risk. Meanwhile, Les commissions a striking masterpiece.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth hatches a plan to get more customers through the pawn shop doors. His new idea backfires, and Les is forced to reconsider his choice of manager.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les's return proves a shock for Seth and Ashley, who have let profits drop in his absence. Back in charge, the manager cuts a deal that could increase profits.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley questions whether the pawn store has a thief in its midst when two teens come in with news of a scam.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Catalina, where they search for some auction treasure - but a shortage of units and time threatens their plans.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: A trip to the hospital takes Allen out of the equation, so it is up to Tom and Big Sis to head to the auction.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Horrific wildfires devastate Greece, hikers in Turkey are stranded by a flash flood and a tornado rips off roofs and catapults cars in Canada.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look ah how pilots attempted to save 509 passengers when a tail fin blew off a Boeing 747 minutes after take-off from an airport in Tokyo.

programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: At RAF King's Cliffe, Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor tells the stories behind artefacts unearthed from former military sites across the UK.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones head to Hollywood seeking stock for their ailing pawn shop business. However, they soon encounter fierce competition for some of the more sought after items.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen and Ton visit Hollywood for some stock for their pawn shop business, and the guys decide to take Big Sis to her first auction.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by TV presenter Gabby Logan and comedian Andy Hamilton, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes Dr Christian Jessen and EastEnder Diane Parish. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings on the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig hosts an extended edition of the panel show, and invites Jason Manford, Sara Pascoe, Jeremy Clarkson and Alan Davies to answer questions on the subject of 'noble rot'. Since the questions are impossible to answer, points are awarded for being interesting rather than correct.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The crew discovers their employer Jupiter Mining Corporation has been bought out by a company and only products made by them are visible to their employees. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Lister celebrates Father's Day, while Rimmer and Kryten install a new computer - the beautiful, but lethally logical Pree - that quickly puts the ship in danger. Comedy series, starring Craig Charles, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Tim and Gendle revisit the best moments from the series' 11 stunts, the biggest wins and losses and there are even some previously unseen moments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Experts analyse the work of engineers including Sir Nigel Gresley, who engineered the world's fastest steam train in 1938 and Eric Laithwaite, whose linear motor made frictionless travel a possibility. These innovators influenced the engineering of the Shanghai Maglev, the fastest passenger train in operation on Earth, which broke numerous engineering boundaries in its construction. Held in place by a series of electromagnets, it levitates on an air gap of 10mm and is able to reach a top speed of 431kms per hour.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.desc: Revisiting the killing of brilliant but controversial young playwright Christopher Marlowe, who was stabbed to death in a Deptford lodging house in 1593.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Arthur of Brittany: The Boy Who Should Have Been King
programme.desc: Prince Arthur of Brittany, who was subjected to the injustice of his bad uncle, John Plantagenet, the usurper of his throne and crown of England.

programme.title: Medieval Murder Mysteries
programme.sub-title: Juan Borgia: A Death in the Dynasty
programme.desc: The infamous Borgia family was devastated when favourite son Juan was murdered in 1497. Here, modern experts set about cracking the case and fingering the killer.

programme.title: Murder Maps
programme.desc: The unsolved murders committed by the Butcher of Kingsbury Run, a serial killer operating in Cleveland, Ohio, in the 1930s. The Butcher killed at least 12 men and women, dismembering their bodies and scattering them across the city.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of the siege of Kohima in 1944, when heavily outnumbered British and Indian troops held off Japanese forces until reinforcements could arrive.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: An account of Hitler's decision to invade the Soviet Union, which produced an initial series of dazzling victories until the harsh winter of 1941 took hold, with fatal consequences for the ill-equipped German army. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Hidden tunnels that saw a city prosper, a sunken wreck with a remarkable past, a concrete wartime dome and a mysterious Cold War building.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Chris Tarrant: Extreme Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Chris journeys a thousand miles across Japan, starting out in Nagasaki, where the story of eastern railways began 150 years ago with the help of an enterprising Brit. In Fukuoka, he visits one of the Bullet Train's giant repair centres and in Hiroshima, he unravels what happened to its streetcar network after the world's first atomic bomb devastated the city. Along the way, Chris also meets a superstar cat and a singing conductor, while also checking into a popular trainspotter hotel and riding a steam-powered mountain railway.

programme.title: Frozen Planet
programme.desc: How animals in the polar regions adapt to the summer weather. In a colony of 400,000 king penguins the adults go surfing and the chicks take mud-baths to cool off, while polar bear cubs take their first swimming lessons as the ice they inhabit melts away. A minke whale is hunted by a family of killer whales, succumbing to their battering after two hours, and Adelie penguins try to prevent their chicks being snatched by skuas.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: Narrow Escapes of World War Two
programme.desc: The story of Major General Roy Urquhart, who successfully evaded the enemy in his retreat across the Rhine after leading British troops into a doomed attack at Arnhem.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Laurence Olivier narrates this documentary chronicling events leading up to the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbour on December 7, 1941, and the subsequent collapse of unprepared British forces before the advancing enemy in Singapore. Includes interviews with veterans from both sides.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The programme looks at a mysterious group of rusting ships stranded in an arid desert, and a monstrous defensive line on the snow-covered peaks of the Italian Alps.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Eye-witness veteran testimony from men who served under fire on the frontline, taking viewers to the heart of iconic moments in the history of warfare. The first episode looks at the Allied invasion of Europe, which began on June 6 1944 - D-Day. British, American and Canadian troops stormed the beaches of Normandy in what would become known as The Longest Day.

programme.title: Secrets of the Third Reich
programme.sub-title: Secrets of the Third Reich: The Search for Hitler's Bomb
programme.desc: Part two of two. A look at Nazi experiments into atomic weapons, examining how close they got to developing a functioning nuclear device before the end of the war.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Projects include a maze of tunnels filled with haunting remains beneath the streets of Paris and a strange formation of domed structures hovering over the waters off Florida.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A village ruin that is now pitted and scarred, a ghostly fleet of ships, a bridge to nowhere hidden in a forest and strange metal structures in a wood.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: A look at the Airbus A380, which as the largest passenger plane ever built can carry more than 850 people non-stop nearly half-way around the world. With the largest wingspan of any commercial aircraft and four specially developed mighty turbo jet engines, the A380 weighs 560 tonnes and getting it off the ground would not have been possible without the work of past innovators such as George Cayley and Frank Whittle. Key developments in aerospace engineering - from Richard Whitcombe's energy-efficient wing-tip designs to Nasa engineers' cutting-edge control system, Fly by Wire - helped bring the A380 to fruition.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The veteran detectives investigate the murder of a palaeontologist at the Natural History Museum, discovering the victim was a respected but outspoken scientist with a knack for rubbing people up the wrong way. When it comes out he was strongly opposed to the museum's sponsorship deal with a large fuel company, the cops soon have plenty of suspects. Amanda Redman stars, with guest appearances by Trevor Bannister, Lucy Brown and Natasha Little.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir discovers Smithy has been canoodling with the wife of notorious local gangster Pete Larson, while arch-rivals Amber and Honey are teamed up yet again, this time to catch a gang defrauding cash machines. June has another bash at warning Sheelagh against getting too involved with Gabriel, and Phil is livid to discover ex-lover Christine is planning on emigrating to Australia - taking their daughter Madison with her.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Hallam gets trapped in a burning shopping centre. Meanwhile, Ariadne realises that Nick has not told anybody about their relationship.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits Barton House in the Cotswolds, where the garden is usually devoid of flowers.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Sarah's annoyance at the invasion of her privacy turns to anger when she is questioned by Jack about her real name. She refuses to answer his questions and is unwilling to be drawn into a defence of her character because she feels she is the one who has had her privacy invaded. However, Jack persists in demanding an explanation, causing her to do the one thing he never expected. Australian drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp.

programme.title: A Place to Call Home
programme.desc: Jack heads out around town with Sarah on her first day at work, but the horrors of the war cast a shadow over Inverness. Meanwhile, Olivia is unable to stop herself from wondering about the woman James admitted to loving in Europe, and makes a shocking discovery. Drama, starring Marta Dusseldorp, Craig Hall, Arianwen Parkes-Lockwood and David Berry.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Zain Nadir discovers Smithy has been canoodling with the wife of notorious local gangster Pete Larson, while arch-rivals Amber and Honey are teamed up yet again, this time to catch a gang defrauding cash machines. June has another bash at warning Sheelagh against getting too involved with Gabriel, and Phil is livid to discover ex-lover Christine is planning on emigrating to Australia - taking their daughter Madison with her.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Nick performs an unnecessary operation in his campaign for a transfer. However, when the patient's condition worsens, Jac is forced to take matters into her own hands. Matt and Dean undergo a student assessment with Lord Byrne, but may not be up to the challenge. Mark is plagued by his secrets as he treats a woman with problems similar to his own.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Part two of two. Amid the chaos of a laboratory bombing, Charlie is shocked to discover a different side to Max and Duffy, an estranged couple are brought together again by their son's critical condition and the team marks Remembrance Day with the customary silence. Starring Derek Thompson.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry appears in court to testify against brother Ben, but reacts badly to being questioned about his own childhood abuse, indirectly jeopardising the outcome of the trial. Phil begins to realise he is powerless to stop former lover Christine emigrating with their daughter Madison, while Smithy spends the night with sultry Louise Larson, unaware Zain Nadir is investigating the criminal activities of her husband Pete.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sanjay takes some advice from Richard, and Mark is concerned about Aidan and Mandy. Gidea and Hattie share a problem..

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Hattie helps Clyde, Michelle is worried about Shelley and Mark, Sanjay is in trouble when he lies to Gita and Cindy is irritated by Ian's support of Hattie.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Nick gets hold of the wrong end of the stick, and Blue Watch play a football match against Borough Street. Meanwhile, the team have to rescue a naked man from a burning flat.

programme.title: Monarch of the Glen
programme.desc: Tensions run high between the family and the villagers after Paul decides the Outdoor Activity Centre should cater for disadvantaged teens as well as corporate clients. Meanwhile, Molly starts Glenbogle's first dating agency, which results in two potential romances for Duncan, but threatens her own relationship with Andrew. Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire star.

programme.title: Where the Heart Is
programme.desc: A good-looking newcomer sets hearts a-flutter among the women of Skelthwaite, but behind the handsome exterior lies a troubled mind. Meanwhile, Linda reveals she needs an urgent operation that will cost 10,000 pounds, and son-in-law David vows to get her the money, but may not be entirely truthful about her illness. Drama, starring Leslie Ash, Lesley Dunlop, Tony Haygarth and Lee Warburton.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Mrs Boswell is rushed to hospital after a day out with her friend Derek, Grandad receives a visit from Lilo Lill.

programme.title: Hi-de-Hi!
programme.desc: Ted's plan to get Clive and Gladys back together requires a scapegoat - in the form of Peggy. Comedy, starring Paul Shane, David Griffin and Ruth Madoc.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel and Jean return from a weekend away to find Judith's boyfriend has been staying at the house. To add to their woes, Alistair announces he has got engaged to a girl named Mercury - dashing their hopes of his ever becoming their son-in-law. Comedy starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Ballad for Wind Instruments and Canoe
programme.desc: The trio stumble across a canoe and decide to take it for an unauthorised trip up the river - but things soon start to go wrong. Meanwhile, Ivy wins a prize for having the best mouth-instrument.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest finds himself embroiled with MI5, which puts Lady Felicia in a compromising position - will she betray her friend to protect secrets from her own past? Drama, starring Mark Williams and Nancy Carroll.

programme.title: The Doctor Blake Mysteries
programme.desc: When Blake is called to investigate the murder of a retired carpenter, his only real suspect is a teenage boy discovered praying over the body and covered in blood.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: DNA tests on a suspected robber prove his innocence but also reveal his father was an unnamed vagrant strangled on a tube train 15 years earlier. The team reopens the case, going in pursuit of the victim's other family members - including the man they believe to be his brother - while Brian questions the homeless community, only to fall foul of a gang of robbers. Peter Davison and Keith Allen guest star.

programme.title: Waking the Dead
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. When the body of salesman Chris Dearden is found in a disused tunnel, investigations reveal he had been reported missing by his wife Lucy in 1996. The ritualistic nature of the murder leads the team to suspect a group of middle-aged men who had been on a self-empowerment weekend. However, the victim's son refuses to believe the body is his father's.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Belgravia
programme.desc: A revelation about Charles' past spells disaster for John and jeopardises his entire future. Anne receives a visit from a former employee, giving Ellis an idea of how to make some money - but she is not as cunning as she thinks. Oliver tries to find ammunition against Charles, and Lady Templemore stands firm on her plans for Maria's upcoming engagement, meaning the young woman must take matters into her own hands.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Tonight
programme.desc: Series of topical investigative reports exploring the stories behind the headlines.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The latest on the coronavirus pandemic with Lorraine Kelly, including medical advice and stories of how people are coping with the lockdown.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: Daily magazine, featuring a mix of celebrity chat, showbusiness news, lifestyle features, topical discussion, health and beauty advice and more.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Guest panellists engage in topical debate and celebrity interviews from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: In England's first National Park, the Peak District, James is joined by restaurateur Tessa Bramley, who serves him a beef fillet alongside vegetables from her own garden. He also takes part in an unusual contest - hen racing - where he challenges a local lad and world champion to a race. After discovering some award-winning gin, James meets a local forager and samples some of his elderflower wine. Finally, he uses some of the foraged elderflowers to make a delicious dessert.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: A team of five family members answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Mandy convinces a sad Paul that Vinny no longer lives with her, but, as everyone else enjoys the wedding reception, she is clearly troubled by the secret she's still keeping. Belle is taken aback when Jamie declares that he loves her and is going to leave Andrea for her.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Asha is sickened to realise somebody posted her naked pictures and they have gone viral, while Leanne is furious to realise Steve is seriously considering taking legal advice. Johnny takes matters into his own hands and Ken's election campaign is on the up.

programme.title: Vera
programme.desc: The detective investigates a suspicious death in an army barracks, aided by Joe and an enthusiastic member of the military police. Although the demise of commanding officer Dev initially looks like suicide, a case for murder is quickly established and the team's first task is to find a motive. Sensing a connection to Ollie, a soldier killed in Afghanistan, Vera interviews the victim's loyal comrades and Ollie's grieving family, discovering a traumatic event that nobody wants to talk about. John Duttine (Heartbeat) guest stars alongside Brenda Blethyn, David Leon, Jon Morrison and Paul Ritter.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Piers Morgan's Life Stories
programme.desc: The host interviews former Baywatch star and Playboy centrefold Pamela Anderson, who reflects on her career and turbulent personal life. She talks about her first husband Tommy Lee, whom she married following a whirlwind four-day courtship, and discusses the nature of her recent relationship with WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange. She also opens up about her role as an animal rights activist, including persuading Vladimir Putin to ban the import of seal products into Russia.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which five members of a running club answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Hit After Hit

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China complete work on the Ford Capri 1.6 Laser.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: A Hollywood blockbuster needs an authentic Second World War SAS jeep within two weeks. It's a tight deadline but military equipment collector Bruce Crompton is determined to meet it, as the wartime SAS is a passion of his.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr and his team are trying to finish the new bike shop, but Paul Sr is upset to discover they have been targeting all of OCC's suppliers.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: With three assets and $3million on the table, Kevin faces one of the most complex missions of his career - so he decides to call in Mike Kennedy for help.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe discovers maintaining a tenpin bowling lane is harder than it looks. The presenter also reveals unusual footage of cameraman Doug.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: How champagne tops, pneumatic delivery systems, espresso machines and pizza ovens are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Stile & Rail Doors/Steam Cleaners/Hand-Held Pizzas/Power Brushes
programme.desc: The manufacturing processes behind the creation of stile and rail doors, steam cleaners, hand-held pizzas and power brushes.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The processes used to turn used aluminium cans into planes and rockets. Plus, the way in which a traditional Black Forest cuckoo clock is carved.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Salvage aficionado Drew Pritchard teams up with Turbo Pickers' Paul Cowland for a motoring mission. The duo head to Staffordshire on the trail of a Ford Capri. They find a beauty, but it's got tatty bodywork and needs a new interior.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The Time Bandit and Cornelia Marie catch large quantities of crabs, but Captain Phil's good mood turns sour when his son reveals a terrible secret.

programme.title: Gold Divers
programme.desc: The dredgers draw in on the midpoint of the shortened mining season, and as it becomes clear that every expedition must count, small miscalculations lead to massive problems.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sets out to buy a Ford Sierra Cosworth on a budget of only 5,000, before handing it over to mechanic Edd China for extensive renovation work.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer settles for a Volkswagen T2 panel van after his budget proves too tight for a classic Camper, and mechanic Edd China agrees to ambitious plans concerning its renovation.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini sets out to find a specific Volvo 960 station wagon. Original owner, actor Paul Newman, fitted this car with a supercharged 5.0 litre V8 engine from a Ford Mustang.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini hits the jackpot when after finding a 1970 Porsche 911 E Targa with low mileage, he secures a near-mint condition 1962 Jaguar Mark 2 3.8 saloon and an unrestored 1932 Stutz DV32 convertible.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Car restorer Wayne Carini starts off the auction season in Amelia Island where he shows a rare Renault Jolly and helps to sell a 1988 Porsche 959 Sport.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: In Devon, Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland fall for the Gallic charm of a Renault 4. It's a rare limited-edition model, but the duo need to replicate its unique interior fabric.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and motorcycle restorer Sam Lovegrove visit the Cotswolds, where they discover sheds full of stationary engines, obscure agricultural implements and some very surprising collections of memorabilia.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove uncover vintage treasures in West Sussex, going behind the scenes at one of Britain's most famous bike shops where, in its dark corners and dusty attics, they find two extraordinary hidden gems.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to a Cold War underground bunker that has been converted to a museum. The curator is looking for some Soviet era equipment to tell the other side of the story.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern-day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard makes a startling find at a 13th-century house in the Lake District. Later, he visits a classic car collector in Hertfordshire.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Skilled craftspeople are bringing Drew Pritchard's finds back to life. With demanding customers and high turnover, their hard work turns trash to treasure purple.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China make a Ford Capri 1.6 Laser roadworthy again.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China complete work on the Ford Capri 1.6 Laser.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Modern day treasure hunter Drew Pritchard visits the medieval Ely Cathedral in Cambridgeshire and finds pew connected a great Victorian architect. Later, he finds a Second World War bomber crew seat at an aviation museum.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits Penzance in Cornwall where he battles a dealer who likes to keep hold of his stock. Heading on to Norfolk, Drew also experiences an enchanting tour through a museum of magic.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: Darrell focuses on a multi-million-dollar wreck tied to Sir Francis Drake. He and his team race to locate a treacherous area identified on the map as Dragon's Teeth.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Facing bankruptcy, Alaskan gold miner Farley Dean treks to Bougainville Island, Papua New Guinea, to seek a fortune apparently guarded by giant, man-eating crocodiles.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Make Assembly Line Robots/Seal Wine Bottles/Desalinate Sea Water
programme.desc: How robots are used to assemble cars, the way wine bottles are sealed and methods for turning sea water into fresh drinking water.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.sub-title: Design Airplane Parachutes/Create Solar Power/Make Photochromic Lenses
programme.desc: How explosive rockets are used to catch crashing planes in mid-air. Plus, why sunbathing techniques help scientists catch rays of sun, and the secrets of sunglasses.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mike Brewer purchases a Toyota MR2 in need of Edd China's expertise, and the mechanic soon gets to work overhauling the car's bodywork.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Edd China continues working on the Toyota MR2, while Mike Brewer heads to a specialist company to get some refurbished wheels.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: The relatives of murderers tell their stories, beginning with Fred West, whose brother Doug and niece Sam reveal how his crimes affected the family.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Richard Ramirez's niece, who grew up not knowing about her uncle's terrible crimes, tells her story. She explains how her parents stood by Ramirez, costing them their marriage.

programme.title: The Killer in My Family
programme.desc: Ian Huntley's ex-girlfriend and daughter tell their side of the story. The pair explain how Huntley abused them for years, before they eventually ended all contact with him.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The co-ordination of law enforcement agencies throughout the USA to apprehend a couple who embarked on a murderous crime spree in the summer of 1984.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: When Barney, a dog with an embedded collar, is spotted in the Houston countryside Investigator Kristi Franks is called into action and a desperate chase ensues.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A Staffordshire bull terrier undergoes radical new surgery to try to fix a gaping hole in its mouth. Plus, Dr Chris Brown attempts to relieve lifeguards of a sunbathing snake.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Former waitress Janine, who is used to striking clothes, has a princess gown in mind. Meanwhile, pregnant bride Christina is worried about her growing body.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Lori's team tries to keep sibling rivalry in check between two sisters getting married within 30 days of each other. Plus, a country bride tries to control her bridesmaids.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.sub-title: Jump for Joy with Your Country Cousins
programme.desc: A bride refuses to pick a dress unless her whole family agrees on it. Plus, another bride tries to find a dress that satisfies both her fiance and sister.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Jennifer puts her budget-conscious father in a cold sweat, while Manette is convinced a gown she already put a deposit on is the one for her.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Arguments ensue when Judea brings along her divorced parents, who have not seen each other for three years, and the bride struggles to keep the drama at bay.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Breast cancer survivor Sonja feels her fiance has already stuck with her for better or worse and should help choose her wedding dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of staff at Bridals by Lori in the Atlanta suburb of Sandy Springs, as well as meeting customers searching for the perfect wedding dress. Bride-to-be Haley clashes with her grandmother over her choice of gown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown treats Tigger the dog, who was hit by a car, Tim Faulkner makes a surprise discovery in one family's walls and a young boxer dog is struggling to walk.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and his team battle to save a puppy with broken ribs and internal bleeding, while Dr Baier attempts surgery he has never done before to treat a family's beloved rat.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 28-year-old Jeremy Alex, who was last seen in April 2004 running towards a house in Northport, Maine claiming that the 'bad guys' were after him.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 16-year-old Molly Bish, who vanished minutes after reporting for her summer job as a lifeguard in June 2000. Her body was found three years later after the largest search in the history of Massachusetts.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of 23-year-old Leah Roberts who vanished in March 2000 after leaving North Carolina to do some soul-searching on a cross-country trip. The Jeep in which she was travelling was found damaged and abandoned a week later 3,000 miles from her home, close to the Canadian border, with some of her personal possessions scattered around it.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of high-profile district attorney Ray Gricar, who went missing from his home area of Pennsylvania in April 2005. His laptop and hard drive were found destroyed in the Susquehanna River, leaving detectives wondering whether he had been murdered or gone on the run.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: A college graduate with a once-promising career, Justin has eaten his life away to the point of never leaving the house for anything but food. Cameras follow his fortunes to turn matters around.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At just 24, Bettie Jo is housebound and reliant on her husband for even her most basic needs. Now, she does her best to shed the pounds.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Three bargain hunters head to Montpellier in southern France in search of items to upcycle. Siobhan identifies a retro tapestry that could be a money-spinner, Raj creates a personalised table top by printing a photograph onto MDF, and Lyn overhauls a 100-year-old cot. The items are later put up for auction in Shoreditch, London.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: James and Jo are taken by surprise when a bumper-car collector looking for a loan turns up at the shop offering an impromptu test drive. Patrick is star-struck when he deals with a bass guitarist known for playing with Eric Clapton, Jamo works hard to authenticate a catalogue thought to be signed by astronaut Neil Armstrong, and a young woman in financial difficulty is desperate to borrow against some paintings so she can make a fresh start.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Dottie loves being a mother but, at over 600lbs, she's on the verge of leaving her two young children motherless. Cameras witness her as she takes drastic action in a bid to turn her life around.

programme.title: Criminal Confessions
programme.desc: A closer look at the psychological showdowns and investigative process inside real-life police interrogation rooms, revealing how they led to shocking confessions.

programme.title: Evil Lives Here
programme.desc: The crimes of John Rose, who had showed signs of violence even when growing up. His sisters Betty and Ulayla recount their story of sharing his life.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of paralympian Oscar Pistorius, who shot his girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp dead in 2013. He claimed it was an accident, but there were suspicions he was falsifying evidence.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: The case of John Tanner, who took part in a police reconstruction when his fiancee vanished. Plus, Paul Dyson whose TV plea for his missing lover raised suspicions. Series examining the phenomenon of criminal cases where people publically feign innocence about a crime they have committed, shedding crocodile tears in the process..
